metadata.Title: CVE-2019-25045 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.19. The XFRM subsystem has a use-after-free, related to an xfrm_state_fini panic, aka CID-dbb2483b2a46.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-25045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-66-generic - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-4.15.0-66-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-4.15.0-66-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-66-generic - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-66-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1052-aws - 4.15.0-1052.54
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-66.75').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.54').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1').
